title: How to Make a Ribbon Bow from a Plastic Straw

steps.headline: Cut the straw into three parts, as shown in the picture.
steps.description: This makes up the main components of the bow. The longest piece forms the main bow and the accordian section forms the tail of the bow. This section needs to be even on either side of the accordion part of the straw.

steps.headline: Cut open the 8.5 centimeter (3.3 in) (3.3") piece (as indicated in the earlier image).
steps.description: With the scissors tip, carefully cut a straight line along the length of this piece.

steps.headline: Fold the cut piece in half.
steps.description: Make sure the fold is centered. This will end up making the bow part even in shape/size.

steps.headline: Cut off the corners at the center fold, as shown in the picture.
steps.description: The cut is at ~1/3 of the width of the straw. The middle third of the straw remains. Click on the image to enlarge, if needed.

steps.headline: Cut open the part of the straw that has the flexible or accordian piece.
steps.description: Again, with the scissors tip, carefully cut a straight line along the length of this piece. Take care in cutting the accordian section as it can twist while cutting.

steps.headline: Stroke down on the end with the back tip of a teaspoon.
steps.description: To make the straw more like a ribbon, it needs to be flattened out. It can help to push it against the surface of a towel, as you flatten it. Continue uncurling until it sits flat.

steps.headline: Fold this piece in half.
steps.description: Make sure the fold is centered. This will end up making the bow tails even in length.

steps.headline: Cut the center in a mountain shape, as shown in the picture.
steps.description: To be able to position the bow tails, cut out a tapered curve at the mid point. The remaining uncut area is ~1/3 of the straw width.

steps.headline: Create the little ring or loop that sits around the longer parts of the bow.
steps.description: Cut a small ring from an intact piece of straw; this will be used to slip over the longer pieces and hold them together.

steps.headline: Place the layers together as shown in the picture.
steps.description: Layer the long bow strip on top of the bow tail. Line up the center of each strip.

steps.headline: Add the loop or ring.
steps.description:
Carefully push the two strips into the bow loop. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Sr13_539.JPG/458px-Sr13_539.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Sr13_539.JPG/756px-Sr13_539.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":174,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":287.4782608695652,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

"}Push it until it reaches the center. The loop is now positioned over the center 1/3 width of the two straw strips. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Sr15_275.JPG/460px-Sr15_275.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/94/Sr15_275.JPG/759px-Sr15_275.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.6521739130435,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Bend the straw part that has the flexible or accordian piece. To form the tails, pull the ends together.

steps.headline: Create the bow shape.
steps.description:
The bow part can now be shaped. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Sr16_675.JPG/459px-Sr16_675.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Sr16_675.JPG/758px-Sr16_675.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.3478260869565,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Loop one side of the 8.5cm (3.3") piece and tuck it into the loop or ring. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Sr17_394.JPG/460px-Sr17_394.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Sr17_394.JPG/759px-Sr17_394.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.3478260869565,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Repeat with the remaining side. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sr18_448.JPG/459px-Sr18_448.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sr18_448.JPG/758px-Sr18_448.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.3478260869565,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}The ribbon or bow is made.

steps.headline: Check that the bow is sitting evenly.
steps.description: Make any adjustments needed. Push in or pull out the straw ends to create an even shape to the bow.

steps.headline: Cut it to any length you like.
steps.description: Trim fancy ends if wished. Cut a "v" notch  in the tail for a little flair.

text:
Cut the straw into three parts, as shown in the picture. This makes up the main components of the bow. The longest piece forms the main bow and the accordian section forms the tail of the bow. This section needs to be even on either side of the accordion part of the straw. Cut open the 8.5 centimeter (3.3 in) (3.3") piece (as indicated in the earlier image). With the scissors tip, carefully cut a straight line along the length of this piece. Fold the cut piece in half. Make sure the fold is centered. This will end up making the bow part even in shape/size. Cut off the corners at the center fold, as shown in the picture. The cut is at ~1/3 of the width of the straw. The middle third of the straw remains. Click on the image to enlarge, if needed. Cut open the part of the straw that has the flexible or accordian piece. Again, with the scissors tip, carefully cut a straight line along the length of this piece. Take care in cutting the accordian section as it can twist while cutting. Stroke down on the end with the back tip of a teaspoon. To make the straw more like a ribbon, it needs to be flattened out. It can help to push it against the surface of a towel, as you flatten it. Continue uncurling until it sits flat. Fold this piece in half. Make sure the fold is centered. This will end up making the bow tails even in length. Cut the center in a mountain shape, as shown in the picture. To be able to position the bow tails, cut out a tapered curve at the mid point. The remaining uncut area is ~1/3 of the straw width. Create the little ring or loop that sits around the longer parts of the bow. Cut a small ring from an intact piece of straw; this will be used to slip over the longer pieces and hold them together. Place the layers together as shown in the picture. Layer the long bow strip on top of the bow tail. Line up the center of each strip. Add the loop or ring. Carefully push the two strips into the bow loop. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Sr13_539.JPG/458px-Sr13_539.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bd/Sr13_539.JPG/756px-Sr13_539.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":174,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":287.4782608695652,"licensing":"

"}The ribbon or bow is made. Check that the bow is sitting evenly. Make any adjustments needed. Push in or pull out the straw ends to create an even shape to the bow. Cut it to any length you like. Trim fancy ends if wished. Cut a "v" notch in the tail for a little flair.
